reviews.review_msg:
Dr. Williams did a great job teaching this course. The material was always interesting and relevant. We also got to decide what topics we would like to learn about. 

If you are taking 391 with him, I strongly recommend taking plenty of notes, and going to office hours if you think you missed something.

Vance is such a funny and caring professor; exams were open book and very fair. Assignments were a bit trickier. Overall, it was a fun class, and it is clear that professor Vance is very knowledgeable
Gem of a teacher. Truely cares for his students and passionate about Chemistry. Engaging lecturer and funny sense of humour.

Dr Williams is a great prof. Even if the lecture material got boring at times, he used his dry humor to get us all through it. Labs were forgiving, i.e. I accidentally dumped my final product down the sink, yet still got 75% on the lab report. Assignments are time consuming but help boost your grade. Tests were fair.
Vance was a great prof, very clear on what's needed to be understood and known in the class. He gives out practice problems makes sure you understand those.

Great prof. Super chill, very helpful in office hours. His practice problems and exams are the key to success... do those, ask about them in office hours if you don't get it, and you'll be prepared for exams. Lecture pace is nice and he goes through examples there. Lab is chill. Textbook unnecessary, but might want to review 281/283 a bit.

Overall really enjoyed the class.  He has extensive knowledge of not just the chemistry but all of interesting history of where the chemistry came from which is neat.  Posts lecture slides ahead of class which I find hugely helpful.  Teaching was clear with lots of examples, no textbook used in either classes I took with him.

He was a decent instructor, clearly having an interest in chemistry. I did well in his class and only attended 66% of the lectures. Overall I liked him as a person and found him to be crystal clear. The only downfall was that there was no textbook.

Dr.Williams is a great chem prof, much easier than Dr.Merbouh, so I would highly recommend him if you need 380 for a Chem minor or major. He is incredibly helpful during office hours, lectures are pretty solid. Also, plenty of hints and practice questions for his exams, and the practice exams are very similar to the actual exams, which is nice.

I did not find his lectures to be of any use, although went to all of them for clickers. I managed to get an A+ in his class solely studying from the textbook, doing multiple problems in the textbook, and reviewing loncapa/tutorial questions.
Will talk for 30 mins for a slide that only has 4 words on it. Doesn't really go over example problems in lecture in detail but that's what tutorial if for. Other than that, OK prof

Useless lectures, only attended for iClicker. Very boring, and spends hours explaining useless simple stuff, then tests on much more difficult problems and concepts. Also very disorganized in his slides as well as in posting marks/exam results. All exams are done on scantron with both multiple choice and exact answer questions.

Difficult to pay attention in class due to his long-winded lecture style, but very helpful during office hours. Gives out some easy marks for iClicker & LonCapa. Preparing for exams was very challenging. Very few problem sets done in class and, as mentioned previously, the LonCapa/tutorial problems are easier than exam problems. Would not recommend

Perhaps due to the simplicity of the materials, Prof. Williams paces in speed that is too slow. Another problem is his wordy lecturing style. Midterms and assignments are extremely easy, whereas the final maybe a little bit more frustrating for some students because of a lack of time. Generally, a recommended professor.

he spends too much time on the easy stuff. The Lon Capa and practice problems are way too easy compared to what was on the final. You cannot prepare for the final in anyway but study the material and pray. Lecture slides were very disorganized, he kept making mistakes and the solutions to the problem sets were full of mistakes. Avoid him.
Great professor, laid back and easy to approach with questions. The only problem was that the lectures were not very indepth and I was hoping more material would be covered.
Great prof.  Interesting course for science or non science major.  Not very difficult. class average on midterm was 72.  easy assignments and exams

i learned nothing in his class. i learned the material thru the textbook, and tutorials were helpful. his midterm was on the easy side, the final was ridiculous (some girl was actually CRYING afterwards). i thought i'd end up with a C- after failing the final (i literally guessed 70% of the test), but somehow, magically, ended up with a B+.

You really have to pay attention to lecture and understand what's going on. His notes are all over the place. I'm not trying to be mean because I got an A+ in his class. Don't let the easy midterm fool you, the final is going to be crazy hard

He's NOT a good organic chem prof.First I should say that I got an "A" in his class so I have no reason to be overly critical BUT his notes are terrible and very unclear.His midterm was way easier than the problem sets and the average was 72 but the final was nothing like the problem sets and it was so hard that most people failed.

the first half of the course was fine, the notes were clear, the midterm was fair. Then after the midterm, the notes were presented on the overhead....that's when things got messy. Overall he is a very good prof, BUT, Lecture slides strongly recommended for the entire duration of the course! Hand written notes make the reactions very confusing! :)

He said we wouldnt need to do the problems at the end of each chapter in the textbook and that his problem sets were very representative of his final. That so wasn't the case I think I should not have taken that advice and have actually done the Q's at the end. Would have helped. But then again the course pack didn't even include a solutions manual

His final was out of this world, totally beyond what we learned in lecture he tricked us into thinking that the final would be reasonable by giving us the easiest midterm ever! I feel like he misrepresented the level of difficulty of organic chemistry making us think it's easy, and decided to give us an idea of how hard it actually is on the final!

His notes are useless cause they are hard to follow and he jumps from concept to concept. The final was completely different from the assigned problem sets and the textbook was not helpful at all. All that studying and practicing the problem sets were NOT enough to do well on the final he gave out.

I could never follow his lectures because he jumped back and forth between concepts. It's hard to comment on him coz I have attended his office hours a few times and he was very helpful. I do however think his final was unfair and so not representative of his problem sets. I feel like I studied for nothing

First off, his notes are so messy, it's impossible to follow them! And personally, I don't think the textbook very helpful either. He went at a painfully slow pace on the easy stuff, then rushed us through all the hard stuff he was going to test us on the final. Problem sets and quizzes NOT an indication of what's on the exam.

:( worst final ever please scale. Let's hope he does or many of us are screwed. People recommended him, so I took this course with him, but in reality, all chem profs are the same...they teach the basics and expect us to do put everything together. Crappy but true

For those of you calling him "the worst prof ever"...GET REAL! he is better than most chem profs, definitely nicer. Ya I agree, his final was brutal, probably the worst and i hated it But he is in fact a good prof and is obviously going to try to give the best possible grade to the class. Vance is cool, so don't talk bad about him personally please

This guy cracks funny jokes in lectures, he is nice, a bit on the tough side with exams. His final definitely turned me off organic chemistry though :s yuck. Hopefully he will scale it will really help our grades. But I think he has a few marking schemes so he will try to give everyone the best possible grade. But scale scale scale! Please! :'(
:( I really really pray that he scales otherwise many of us will fail :(

His notes were too messy I had no idea what he was talking about! at all! but i did enjoy going to his class which is weird because I can't stand chemistry So he must have been doing something right. The midterm average was fine but I wouldn't expect the same for the final. Make sure you learn every reaction before each class or u won't have a clue

That's why I think he should perhaps consider changing his teaching style a bit Maybe have 2 midterms instead of 1, so students can be more prepared for the final, and can have a better understanding of the types of reaction questions that will be asked on the final that way students will actually learn the material rather than memorizing reactions

I like vance williams. He is awesome, was very helpful during office hours, and he is funny. I admit his final was not at all what I expected considering the midterm was reasonably fair, I think he took things slow at first, and then bombarded us with all these reactions we have never seen before which can be quite overwhelming for 1st time O. Chem

I'm not sure what to think of that final we just had. Either that was the worst thing I have ever written, or I didn't study as well as I should have. I don't blame Vance, because frankly I thought he is better than most chem profs. But I think he overestimated our intelligence, which is somewhat flattering, but at the same time, come on! :S
I'm just curious if anyone actually found the final easy. Everyone I saw was freaking out afterwards

I was looking at Dr. Paduraru's previous problem sets from 281, Vance's exam was more like her problem sets than his! Not implying anything, I'm just saying I would have done better if I had done her problem sets. I still like Vance, but I don't know why he made his final impossible to finish

That was the hardest exam ever! His midterm was so easy, and it really represented his problem sets and everything in lecture. HOWEVER, his final was nothing like anything I've seen in lecture and on problem sets!

I thought I had everything under control! Did well on the midterm, did well in the lab and the quizzes, i read the textbook and his notes, but WHAT WAS THAT! THE FINAL WAS BRUTAL! Either the whole class is stupid, or he was unfair. I still think he is a good prof, but his exam was WAYYY TOO HARD!

he is such a bad prof! he barely teaches anything in class, gives really easy practise problems and when it comes to the final exam you are totally screwed over! his exam is so impossible and hard! he is a horrible horrible prof! never take a class with him. biggest mistake of my life

horrible prof! he spends too much time teaching easy stuff and now he's rushing everything. He only taught 5 reactions when there are about 20 to learn. This is not what organic chemistry is about! If you want to pass 282 take this course with another prof!
Bestest nicest prof ever...he really cares about his students
Best prof ever,really nice and helpful,always available for any Qs,may spend an hour to make sure you got your answer on his office hours
he is the best prof ever!

an alright prof, pretty friendly and easy to get along with. lec can be boring so prepare to do some self learning. midterms are ok. assignments and lab reports are fine as long as you have friends who get whats going on. gives lot of extensions=)

vance is a nice prof. good notes but doesn't follow the textbook closely which is understandable for an organic chem course. the problem sets closely resemble his exam questions so be sure to do them. it's a hard course so be prepared to work for your grade!

An alright prof, his exams are fair, final might be a bit harder. Be sure to do the problem sets and attend tutorials. His notes are ok, its more clear when you read the book. He has 3 marking schemes, so that you can achieve the highest mark possible, which is good :)
He is the best prof I've ever met in SFU.I waited for almost one year and a half to choose his course.sounds stupid, but the waiting is worth. He makes everything clear, I learn a lot.
he's a laid-back dude; study the homework

I took chem 281 with Vance a I must say that he's one of the nicer guys out there. He's available for help more than need be and will not make you fell like S#%^ if you don't know something. He could be funny too at times. I approve of him.

GREAT PROF>GREAT. This guy knows whats up, exams were fair class was good, his notes were good. His pace at first was like baby steps, but then he picked up. Class average was were it should be at a "C". If you tried the homework, you knew what was on the exam, Excellent professor over all i hope he teaches organic II soon, I'm waiting for him.

Prof was friendly & approachable. Assignments for this Breadth-Science course were interesting to do(e.g. Paper bags vs. Plastic Bags) with lax marking scheme. Ppt notes seldom available on time. Final exam took ~1/2 hr & came totally from the lectures. Lots of demos in class to keep things interesting. No tutorials, just go ask him Q's if need be.
HE is a very good lecturer...

Goes at a mind numbingly slow pace, but better too slow than too fast. Make good notes in class and do every problem set because the textbook is utterly useless. Also it is very helpful to have the model set for the tests, even if you dont think you'll use it.
Goes through material very slowly, but clearly, although he was kind of iffy on details, but luckily I had a great TA (Brendan W.). Midterms were straight foreward. Textbook was USELESS.

Good prof overall! He's a great lecturer and he does the best teaching some uninteresting material.  His exams are usually very fair.  Make sure u ask questions, review, do the hw cuz u can very quickly fall behind.  His final is similar to the midterms..so if u know everything, then you'll be fine.  One of the better chem profs i've had.
Moves way too slowly through material, but he is very clear in what he does cover.
very clear on explaining course materials. Best prof so far
He's slow-paced and very clear in writing notes. But this course still requires lots of practice if you want to get high marks on the exam.
Great Prof! notes easy to follow, fair exams
TIME FOR THE LANCE VANCE DANCE!! OK TOO MUCH VICE CITY... no seriously, this prof is very good at teaching...
for those of you who are in chem281 this semester, the materials you've been learning are not what organic chem's about..good luck to those who'll be taking chem282
he is not so bad. nice notes and slow space on the class. so either so can fully understand, or u can fall asleep quickily.
he is overall a good teacher. he taughts very slowly but easy to understand.  he gives us the main point that we need.  exams are fair.  first exam is easy, but second exam is a bit tough.
Significantly lowers the level of material taught to pass would-be doctors. Course is too easy and does not teach enough. Moves too slow and covers material already taught in 121/122.

Goes at a slow pace, which would normally make me fall asleep but I find that I never get bored in his class and understand almost everything he says.  Pretty good prof - very organized. 1st midterm was fair, 2nd midterm was a bit tough.
Vance is a pretty cool professeur. He is really helpful one on one.
V. slow pace, colourful handwrttn notes, speaks clearly, pauses a lot. Exams are fair. Extremely nice nerdy young guy.
his exams are fair......and his notes are really useful for studying
Very fair.
Likes to eush things at the end and tests it on final
No Comments
dull yet his tests are somewhat easier than Neil's
goes over material too fast.  Thinks he's super-smart, does not respect students
enthusiastic! :)
